review: This worked great when I initially purchased it.  Then other things (life in general) took me away from TV for awhile.  When I tried to use this last evening, I couldn't make it work and became very frustrated.  The instructions seemed simple, but I couldn't get it to work.  I gave this a negative review.  Amazon support noticed and sent me some links to try and troubleshoot my problem. They worked, and I discovered a lot of features I didn't know exited, like being able to use my iPhone to control it.When I looked for help, all I seemed to be able to find was marketing info about why I should by this.  I would give it 5 stars if they made trouble shooting links easier to find. I do really appreciate Amazon reaching out in my frustration.

review: Fire TV stick is cool for the price point as other reviewers state..  great to turn a dumb TV into a smart TV etc, but I wanted to share a couple of additional points. I was in the market for a projector style home theater system and had been doing a ton of research. There are hardly any "smart" HD projectors, so was curious, could the stock solve for that. Short answer: yes... and it's so cool. Imagine having a theater room where there are no cables to run from the projector yet you have Netflix, Prime content, music and more. We are also avid campers and I got to thinking, man how fun would it be to use this for an outdoor movie night?  I picked up a cheap $46 mini projector to see how that would go and same result as far as function, albeit picture quality is not as high end as a true home theater projector.  Still quite the novelty at the campground... a real crowd pleaser and keeps the kids entertained.Only peeve I have with the sick is that it doesn't charge via the HDMI port and you must give it a secondary power supply. So you hsve the elegant stick, but tgen a power chord sticking out of it which takes away from its simple charm.  This is a limitation of HDMI ports in general, though and hopefully someday they will make HDMI more like USB from a charging standpoint.

review: My dad got this for me during the Prime member pre sale.  I think it was $19.  At first it was little disappointing, but when Amazon added HBO Go and they added the interface for signing into hotel Internet, it became the greatest thing on earth. I'm a flight attendant and its saved me so many nights of mindlessly watching the Weather Channel or HGTV.  I highly recommend this for frequent travelers.
